predictions.text: S&P 500 will close at least 2.0% higher on 2025-12-31 than its close on 2025-12-22.
predictions.verification_criteria: Compare official S&P 500 close on 2025-12-22 vs 2025-12-31 (S&P Dow Jones Indices or Bloomberg/Refinitiv). Condition is met if Close(2025-12-31) / Close(2025-12-22) - 1 >= 0.02.
evidence: Market commentary highlights positioning for a late-December 'Santa rally' after a choppy month (MarketWatch, 2025-12-21).
monitoring_signals: Daily S&P 500 closes and breadth (advance/decline)
Flows into U.S. equity ETFs and dealer gamma/positioning commentary
Key U.S. macro prints and rate-volatility (MOVE index) into year-end
predictions.rationale: Year-end seasonality and positioning support a bounce, but macro sensitivity and thin liquidity raise downside tail risk; 2% is achievable yet far from assured.

predictions.text: China’s PBoC will cut the 1-year Loan Prime Rate (LPR) by at least 10 basis points versus its 2025-12-22 level by 2026-03-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the official published 1-year LPR on the LPR setting dates. The prediction is true if any published 1-year LPR by 2026-03-31 is at least 0.10 percentage points lower than the published 1-year LPR as of 2025-12-22.
evidence: China kept benchmark lending rates unchanged despite weak data (CNBC, 2025-12-22).
monitoring_signals: Monthly LPR fixings and PBoC guidance
Medium-term lending facility (MLF) rate changes and liquidity operations
China credit impulse, property sales/starts, and CPI/PPI trends
predictions.rationale: Weak domestic demand and property stress argue for easing, but policy reluctance and RMB stability constraints can delay LPR cuts.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Justice will publicly announce a criminal case (complaint/indictment/arrest) involving alleged PRC-directed transnational repression activity on U.S. soil by 2026-06-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: A DOJ press release (justice.gov) or unsealed federal court filing must explicitly allege PRC/PRC-linked direction or coordination of harassment/coercion/illegal operations targeting individuals in the U.S. for political speech (i.e., transnational repression).
evidence: Reporting highlights concerns about China targeting critics in the U.S., increasing scrutiny of influence operations (NYT, 2025-12-21).
monitoring_signals: DOJ National Security Division press releases and FBI public statements
New FARA-related enforcement actions tied to PRC-linked actors
Congressional hearings or letters on transnational repression
predictions.rationale: Elevated attention and prior enforcement patterns make another case plausible, but timing depends on investigative cycles and evidentiary thresholds.

predictions.text: Canada’s federal government will announce new border-enforcement measures specifically targeting illegal firearm smuggling from the U.S., including either (a) new dedicated funding of at least C$100M or (b) a new legislative bill introduced in Parliament, by 2026-06-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified by an official Government of Canada announcement (e.g., Public Safety Canada/CBSA) that either specifies >= C$100,000,000 in new funding explicitly for cross-border firearms interdiction or confirms tabling a bill whose stated purpose includes reducing illegal firearm smuggling from the U.S.
evidence: Rising Canadian gun violence linked to U.S.-sourced firearms increases pressure for cross-border enforcement (NYT, 2025-12-21).
monitoring_signals: Federal budget/mini-budget line items and Public Safety Canada announcements
CBSA seizure statistics and joint task force announcements
Parliament bill introductions and committee agendas on firearms/smuggling
predictions.rationale: Political salience and bilateral enforcement optics favor action; exact scale and legislative path remain uncertain.

predictions.text: The European Commission will publish a formal legislative proposal (COM document) that changes or delays at least one key element of the EU’s 2035 light-duty vehicle zero-CO2 target / ICE phaseout framework by 2026-06-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: True if the European Commission publishes a COM-numbered proposal amending the relevant regulations/directives such that it (i) alters the 2035 target, (ii) introduces a compliance derogation/extension, or (iii) creates a new pathway materially affecting the phaseout (e.g., broader e-fuels carveout).
evidence: Reports of EU watering down 2035 EV targets raise policy uncertainty (TechCrunch, 2025-12-21).
monitoring_signals: European Commission work programme and mobility/climate legislative calendar
EU Council/Parliament negotiation updates on CO2 standards
Automaker lobbying signals and member-state position papers
predictions.rationale: Public debate and competitiveness pressures make a proposal plausible, but institutional friction could slow a formal COM issuance.

predictions.text: California regulators will open a formal proceeding (e.g., CPUC Order Instituting Investigation or DMV enforcement action) explicitly referencing the San Francisco robotaxi service disruption during the reported blackout-related incident, by 2026-03-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: True if CPUC, CA DMV, or NHTSA posts an official docket entry/order/action that explicitly cites the SF outage/blackout disruption described in public reporting and initiates a formal investigation/enforcement process (not just an information request).
evidence: Waymo paused SF robotaxi service after a blackout, highlighting infrastructure dependence and reliability issues (NYT, 2025-12-21).
monitoring_signals: CPUC AV docket postings and meeting agendas
CA DMV AV permit action logs and suspension notices
NHTSA ODI inquiries/standing general orders updates
predictions.rationale: Regulators often respond to high-visibility AV incidents, but this event may be treated as operational rather than safety-critical, lowering odds of a formal proceeding.

predictions.text: Challenger, Gray & Christmas (or another widely cited U.S. layoff tracker) will report at least 150,000 U.S. job-cut announcements explicitly attributed to AI/automation in 2026 H1 (Jan–Jun).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if a reputable tracker’s published aggregation for 2026-01-01 through 2026-06-30 states cumulative announced layoffs explicitly attributed to AI/automation >= 150,000 (either in a single report or via monthly totals that sum to >=150,000).
evidence: Reports cite AI in 50,000+ layoffs in 2025, suggesting acceleration of AI-attributed displacement (CNBC, 2025-12-21).
monitoring_signals: Monthly Challenger job-cut reports and category breakdowns
Large-company WARN notices and earnings-call layoff rationales
Major tech and retail restructuring announcements referencing automation/AI
predictions.rationale: AI attribution is rising but classification is noisy; hitting 150k in six months requires multiple very large restructurings being explicitly labeled as AI-driven.

predictions.text: A CO2-based energy storage technology provider will announce commercial operation (COD) of a grid-connected project with nameplate energy capacity of at least 10 MWh by 2026-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: True if a project developer or utility announces COD for a grid-connected CO2-based storage system (compressed/liquefied/supercritical CO2 cycle) with >=10 MWh stated capacity; press release, regulatory filing, or utility project page acceptable.
evidence: CO2-based energy storage systems are gaining traction as long-duration alternatives (IEEE Spectrum, 2025-12-21).
monitoring_signals: Utility interconnection queues and public IRP filings mentioning CO2 storage
DOE/ARPA‑E award updates and project milestone announcements
Developer press releases indicating commissioning timelines and capacity
predictions.rationale: Momentum exists, but scaling to 10 MWh grid COD depends on financing, permitting, and execution risk typical for first-of-kind deployments.

predictions.text: The U.S. (NOAA, USGS, or FEMA) will announce at least $50M in new federal funding awards specifically for tsunami risk mitigation or evacuation infrastructure in Alaska by 2026-09-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: True if an official federal announcement (press release, grants database update, or Federal Register notice) awards or allocates >=$50,000,000 in aggregate for Alaska tsunami mitigation (e.g., evacuation routes/towers, warning systems, resilience infrastructure), with tsunami risk explicitly cited.
evidence: New research highlights hidden seismic signals indicating Alaska tsunami risk, raising planning and insurance implications (ScienceDaily, 2025-12-21).
monitoring_signals: FEMA BRIC/HAZMIT grant award cycles and NOAA tsunami program funding notices
Alaska delegation appropriations announcements
USGS/NOAA hazard updates tied to Alaska coastal communities
predictions.rationale: Improved risk characterization can support funding, but large dedicated allocations face appropriations and program-eligibility constraints.

predictions.text: The U.S. government will publicly report (press release or official statement) the seizure, detention, or forced diversion to a U.S.-controlled port/anchorage of at least one tanker carrying Venezuelan-origin crude or products by 2026-03-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: True if a U.S. federal agency (USCG, DOJ, Treasury, DHS) publicly states it seized/detained/diverted a tanker and explicitly links the cargo to Venezuelan-origin crude/oil products (or Venezuela-linked sanctions-evading shipments).
evidence: U.S. Coast Guard pursuit of a Venezuela-linked oil tanker signals tighter enforcement risk (NYT, 2025-12-21).
monitoring_signals: USCG district press releases and DHS/DOJ asset forfeiture announcements
OFAC enforcement actions referencing maritime shipments
AIS/shiptracking anomalies and insurer/charterer advisories tied to Venezuela routes
predictions.rationale: Enforcement intensity is rising, but moving from pursuit/interdiction activity to publicly disclosed seizure/diversion depends on legal posture and operational opportunities.
